metadata.Title: CVE-2021-1788 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. This issue is fixed in macOS Big Sur 11.2, Security Update 2021-001 Catalina, Security Update 2021-001 Mojave, tvOS 14.4, watchOS 7.3, iOS 14.4 and iPadOS 14.4, Safari 14.0.3. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-1788` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.32.0-1ubuntu3').
wpewebkit package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
